description.text:
The Quantum Collective is an innovative music marketing company that brings musicians, artists, celebrities and consumer brands together through original programs and live events.  Check out the promo reel from the QC's Southwest Invasion: An Amazing Live Event during the SXSW music festival in Austin, Texas.
For more information on Quantum Collective, please visit: QuantumCollective.com.
 The founders of Quantum Collective include:
Liz Leahy, the CEO and co-founder of Section 101, the premier website solution for the music and entertainment industry.  The company offers a premier service for clients who prefer Section 101 to supply creative input – from design and development through to the successful launch of their website - as well as a Do-It-Yourself Solution that provides all the tools and functionality required for clients to create their own unique website on a budget.  
Dan Silver is VP of Creative and Sr. Producer at RipTide Music Group, a Sync flavored Publishing Company specializing in worldwide placements for Advertising, Film, Television, Film Trailers, and Video Games. As co-founder, Dan’s unique approach to curating live talent for the Quantum Collective continues to yield a stellar two-day line-up including emerging and well-established artists. Also being an Artist and Producer himself, Dan brings artistic perspective as Co-producer of the event.
 Allison Shaw, founder of Manic Monkee, specializes in artist management, brand development, sponsorship and event planning in the entertainment space. Her brands past and present include Music Charity Sweet Relief , Hip Hop band Public Enemy, Ticketfly, Jakprints, SongFreaks, Rachael Ray Feedback, .music, Spit Digital, Stageit.com, Beatport, Listen Records/Sony and more.Visit QuantumCollective.com for more information.
description.html:
The Quantum Collective is an innovative music marketing company that brings musicians, artists, celebrities and consumer brands together through original programs and live events. Check out the promo reel from the QC's Southwest Invasion: An Amazing Live Event during the SXSW music festival in Austin, Texas.

For more information on Quantum Collective, please visit: QuantumCollective.com.


The founders of Quantum Collective include:

Liz Leahy, the CEO and co-founder of Section 101, the premier website solution for the music and entertainment industry. The company offers a premier service for clients who prefer Section 101 to supply creative input – from design and development through to the successful launch of their website - as well as a Do-It-Yourself Solution that provides all the tools and functionality required for clients to create their own unique website on a budget.

Dan Silver is VP of Creative and Sr. Producer at RipTide Music Group, a Sync flavored Publishing Company specializing in worldwide placements for Advertising, Film, Television, Film Trailers, and Video Games. As co-founder, Dan’s unique approach to curating live talent for the Quantum Collective continues to yield a stellar two-day line-up including emerging and well-established artists. Also being an Artist and Producer himself, Dan brings artistic perspective as Co-producer of the event.

Allison Shaw, founder of Manic Monkee, specializes in artist management, brand development, sponsorship and event planning in the entertainment space. Her brands past and present include Music Charity Sweet Relief , Hip Hop band Public Enemy, Ticketfly, Jakprints, SongFreaks, Rachael Ray Feedback, .music, Spit Digital, Stageit.com, Beatport, Listen Records/Sony and more.

Visit QuantumCollective.com for more information.

description.text:
Ticket Info     All BoomTown residency passes provide you with four days and nights of fun inside the city. You will become part of the cast, the character you always dreamed of and a true resident in our crazy, immersive world!!      Please note: There are three tiers of Adult Residency Passes available but the only difference in these is the price. All are valid from Thursday 13th - Sunday 16th August and allow access to all the general public spaces throughout the site. 
There are no day tickets.   BoomTown Residency Ticket Breakdown    Adult Residency Pass (age 18+) Plus BF & EcoBond 
            -           Tier 1: £120 
            -           Tier 2: £135 
            -           Tier 3: £155   
Teen Residency Pass (age 13-17) Plus BF & EcoBond.  
-           £120 (Max of 2 purchased per adult over 25)   
Child Residency Pass (age 6-12) Plus BF 
-           £20 (Max of 3 purchased per adult over 25)   
Infant Residency Pass (age 0-5) Plus BF 
-           £FREE (Although ticket is free it must still be ordered) 
  
Car Parking 
Car Parking tickets are available at £15 plus BF. The main car park is a short walk from the main pedestrian gate. Have you considered car sharing?  You can find out more here. 
  
Family Parking  
Family parking tickets are availble at £15 plus BF allowing those who hold these tickets to park in designated parking spaces next to the entry gate, which is a short walk straight to the fenced off family camping site situated near Kidztown, Whistlers Green and OldTown. 
  
The Meadow Parking (Disabled) 
The Meadow parking tickets are availble at £15 plus BF allowing those who hold these tickets to park in designated parking spaces next to the entry gate, which is a very short walk straight to the fenced Meadow camping site situated in the campervan field near Whistlers Green, TrenchTown and OldTown.  If you require access to The Meadow, please contact us on info@boomtownfair.co.uk, so we can prepare for your arrival and individual requirements in order to make sure your entry to the festival is as smooth and easy as possible for you. 
  
Family and The Meadow (Disabled) Campervan / Caravan Passes 
Family and The Meadow Campervan and Caravan tickets are available to gain access to the live-in vehicle campsite situtated close to KidzTown & Whistlers Green.  Please note access to the family campsite is ONLY valid with Infant, Child or Teen Tickets.  To gain access to The Meadow, you should pre-arrange your arrival so we can send you a specific entry pass.  Please make contact with us on info@boomtownfair.co.uk.  More Info Here 
  
Lockers 
Lockers, standard and large,  are available in both DownTown and HillTop.  DownTown lockers are located near the DownTown Info Island.   You should book these lockers if you live in ChinaTown, DSTRKT 5 or Barrio Loco.  The HillTop lockers are located near HillTop Info Island. You should book these lockers if you live in Mayfair, OldTown, Whistlers Green or TrenchTown. 
  
EcoBond Part of the 'Keep BoomTown tidy' scheme, a £10 deposit for EcoBond is added on and is refunded when a bag of rubbish or recycling is handed back into an onsite depot. More info here 
  
Ticket purchasing limitations  Teen, Child and Infant tickets are only valid for persons between the stated ages and will be invalid on entry to the festival without the accompaniment of the purchasing adult over the age of 25.    An adult ticket can only be bought by persons aged 18 or over (may be purchased by persons who will be 18 as of 13th August 2015)    Persons will be refused entry into the festival, without refund, if the incorrect ticket is purchased.   
  
The split-payment scheme - for those who prefer things to be a bit more bite-size and separate the payments into manageable chunks to pay off over a few months. Tickets must be paid in full by 1st July 2015. All payments are non-refundable. Instructions to pay off the installments can be found here. 
  
Magic Carpet  
Many residents feel this is the essential transportation method that links Downtown to HillTop, 120mtr escalator that bypasses the horrendous hippy highway - a £10 ticket gives unlimited access to the magic carpet all weekened   
  
Charity support  There is an option to donate £2, £5 or £10 to our charity partners for 2015, all donations are matched by BoomTown. We will be donating to three separate charities The Energy Revolution Initiative, Winchester Youth Counselling and Trinity Winchester.  
  

Winchester Youth Counselling (WYC):  Winchester Youth Counselling provide free counselling, mentoring and other support to young people aged between 11 and 25 who live in the district of winchester who are struggling with issues such as depression, self harm, risk of suicide, and other issues concerning their emotional and physical well being. For more information, click here.
Trinity WInchester:  Trinity Winchester is a charity which addresses the effects of homelessness and vulnerability through specialist practical and emotional support, proactive prevention and empowering positive change.  They are the only service locally who are professionally equipped to work with entrenched rough sleepers with drug and alcohol issues and is renowned by local organisations for engaging effectively with those considered 'high risk'. For more information, click here.
The Energy Revolution Initiative: Please join the Energy Revolution by making a donation to account for your travel carbon.  100% of your donation will be invested directly into renewable energy. Together we can build a fossil-­free future. For more information, click here.

 

GIFT AID:  If you are a UK taxpayer please help us cover the costs of running the charity by consenting to Gift Aid being claimed on your donation. They can claim 25p for every £1 you donate from HMRC if you tick the box below after reading the following:
Please treat this donation as Gift Aid donation. I confirm I have paid or will pay an amount of Income Tax and/or Capital Gains Tax for the current tax year (6 April to 5 April) that is at least equal to the amount of tax that all the charities that I donate to will reclaim on my gifts for the current tax year. I understand that other taxes such as VAT and Council Tax do not qualify. I understand the charity will reclaim 25p of tax on every £1 that I have given. I consent to Energy Revolution, Trinity & WYC receiving my contact details to verify the donation to HMRC, and to provide me with information about the impact of my donation.


  

Additional Options 
Boom Deluxe – upgrade your camping experience with two Boom Deluxe options: 
 1)    Zooloos – clean toilets, hot private showers and pamper areas with hair dryers & straighteners.  
2)    Reserved Camping – aimed to take the hassle out of hunting for a camping space and for those who are coming in a big group. Pitches are 5m x7m and you can choose how many pitches you’d like and where you’d like to pitch up before getting anywhere near the festival site!  
More info on Boom Deluxe options here 
The Boomtique Village Wristband - Provides access to the sumptuous surroundings of the Boomtique village and the hot tubs, saunas, exclusive entertainment, plus much more! More info here
description.html:
Ticket Info

All BoomTown residency passes provide you with four days and nights of fun inside the city. You will become part of the cast, the character you always dreamed of and a true resident in our crazy, immersive world!!

Please note: There are three tiers of Adult Residency Passes available but the only difference in these is the price. All are valid from Thursday 13th - Sunday 16th August and allow access to all the general public spaces throughout the site.

There are no day tickets.

BoomTown Residency Ticket Breakdown

Adult Residency Pass (age 18+) Plus BF & EcoBond

- Tier 1: £120

- Tier 2: £135

- Tier 3: £155

Teen Residency Pass (age 13-17) Plus BF & EcoBond.

- £120 (Max of 2 purchased per adult over 25)

Child Residency Pass (age 6-12) Plus BF

- £20 (Max of 3 purchased per adult over 25)

Infant Residency Pass (age 0-5) Plus BF

- £FREE (Although ticket is free it must still be ordered)


Car Parking

Car Parking tickets are available at £15 plus BF. The main car park is a short walk from the main pedestrian gate. Have you considered car sharing? You can find out more here.


Family Parking

Family parking tickets are availble at £15 plus BF allowing those who hold these tickets to park in designated parking spaces next to the entry gate, which is a short walk straight to the fenced off family camping site situated near Kidztown, Whistlers Green and OldTown.


The Meadow Parking (Disabled)

The Meadow parking tickets are availble at £15 plus BF allowing those who hold these tickets to park in designated parking spaces next to the entry gate, which is a very short walk straight to the fenced Meadow camping site situated in the campervan field near Whistlers Green, TrenchTown and OldTown. If you require access to The Meadow, please contact us on info@boomtownfair.co.uk, so we can prepare for your arrival and individual requirements in order to make sure your entry to the festival is as smooth and easy as possible for you.


Family and The Meadow (Disabled) Campervan / Caravan Passes

Family and The Meadow Campervan and Caravan tickets are available to gain access to the live-in vehicle campsite situtated close to KidzTown & Whistlers Green. Please note access to the family campsite is ONLY valid with Infant, Child or Teen Tickets. To gain access to The Meadow, you should pre-arrange your arrival so we can send you a specific entry pass. Please make contact with us on info@boomtownfair.co.uk. More Info Here


Lockers

Lockers, standard and large, are available in both DownTown and HillTop. DownTown lockers are located near the DownTown Info Island. You should book these lockers if you live in ChinaTown, DSTRKT 5 or Barrio Loco. The HillTop lockers are located near HillTop Info Island. You should book these lockers if you live in Mayfair, OldTown, Whistlers Green or TrenchTown.


EcoBond
Part of the 'Keep BoomTown tidy' scheme, a £10 deposit for EcoBond is added on and is refunded when a bag of rubbish or recycling is handed back into an onsite depot. More info here


Ticket purchasing limitations
Teen, Child and Infant tickets are only valid for persons between the stated ages and will be invalid on entry to the festival without the accompaniment of the purchasing adult over the age of 25.

An adult ticket can only be bought by persons aged 18 or over (may be purchased by persons who will be 18 as of 13th August 2015)

Persons will be refused entry into the festival, without refund, if the incorrect ticket is purchased.


The split-payment scheme - for those who prefer things to be a bit more bite-size and separate the payments into manageable chunks to pay off over a few months. Tickets must be paid in full by 1st July 2015. All payments are non-refundable. Instructions to pay off the installments can be found here.


Magic Carpet

Many residents feel this is the essential transportation method that links Downtown to HillTop, 120mtr escalator that bypasses the horrendous hippy highway - a £10 ticket gives unlimited access to the magic carpet all weekened


Charity support
There is an option to donate £2, £5 or £10 to our charity partners for 2015, all donations are matched by BoomTown. We will be donating to three separate charities The Energy Revolution Initiative, Winchester Youth Counselling and Trinity Winchester.


  • Winchester Youth Counselling (WYC): Winchester Youth Counselling provide free counselling, mentoring and other support to young people aged between 11 and 25 who live in the district of winchester who are struggling with issues such as depression, self harm, risk of suicide, and other issues concerning their emotional and physical well being. For more information, click here.
  • Trinity WInchester: Trinity Winchester is a charity which addresses the effects of homelessness and vulnerability through specialist practical and emotional support, proactive prevention and empowering positive change. They are the only service locally who are professionally equipped to work with entrenched rough sleepers with drug and alcohol issues and is renowned by local organisations for engaging effectively with those considered 'high risk'. For more information, click here.
  • The Energy Revolution Initiative: Please join the Energy Revolution by making a donation to account for your travel carbon. 100% of your donation will be invested directly into renewable energy. Together we can build a fossil-­free future. For more information, click here.

  • GIFT AID: If you are a UK taxpayer please help us cover the costs of running the charity by consenting to Gift Aid being claimed on your donation. They can claim 25p for every £1 you donate from HMRC if you tick the box below after reading the following:
  • Please treat this donation as Gift Aid donation. I confirm I have paid or will pay an amount of Income Tax and/or Capital Gains Tax for the current tax year (6 April to 5 April) that is at least equal to the amount of tax that all the charities that I donate to will reclaim on my gifts for the current tax year. I understand that other taxes such as VAT and Council Tax do not qualify. I understand the charity will reclaim 25p of tax on every £1 that I have given. I consent to Energy Revolution, Trinity & WYC receiving my contact details to verify the donation to HMRC, and to provide me with information about the impact of my donation.

Additional Options

Boom Deluxe – upgrade your camping experience with two Boom Deluxe options:

1) Zooloos – clean toilets, hot private showers and pamper areas with hair dryers & straighteners.

2) Reserved Camping – aimed to take the hassle out of hunting for a camping space and for those who are coming in a big group. Pitches are 5m x7m and you can choose how many pitches you’d like and where you’d like to pitch up before getting anywhere near the festival site!

More info on Boom Deluxe options here

The Boomtique Village Wristband - Provides access to the sumptuous surroundings of the Boomtique village and the hot tubs, saunas, exclusive entertainment, plus much more! More info here

description.text: BoomTown’s rapid growth since its inception in 2009 has seen it become one of the top 10 largest festivals in the UK and the only independent one of its size! With it's sprawling metropolis providing a temporary haven of hidden surprises, pulsating music and immersive audio-visuals to allow each of its thousands of citizens to go on an ultimate voyage of discovery within the labyrinth-esque streets. With a soundtrack of ska, folk, gypsy, reggae, world, punk, pirate, disco, electro-swing, jazz, blue-grass, breaks, bass, jungle, techno and a whole lot more!
description.html: BoomTown’s rapid growth since its inception in 2009 has seen it become one of the top 10 largest festivals in the UK and the only independent one of its size! With a soundtrack of ska, folk, gypsy, reggae, world, punk, pirate, disco, electro-swing, jazz, blue-grass, breaks, bass, jungle, techno and a whole lot more!

name.text: HIGH TIMES Cannabis Cup: Denver April 18th-20th
name.html: HIGH TIMES Cannabis Cup: Denver April 18th-20th

description.text:
In 2015, HIGH TIMES will return to the Mile High City for our fifth event at the Denver Mart. Our first two events in Denver were Medical Cannabis Cups, restricted to medical patients only. But Colorado voters legalized adult, recreational use of marijuana in the 2012 election, which resulted in our most successful Cannabis Cup ever. We now host the US Cannabis Cup, an event open to all adults. 

This event (expo and Saturday night party) is for all adults ages 18+ EXCEPT FOR SUPER VIP & GOLD LEAF VIP which is 21+ only.  21+ to enter Recreating (smoking) Area. 
You do not need a medical card to attend the expo.  
Tickets are non-refundable, but they are transferable and may be resold to someone else if you are unable to attend

  
Event Details  
SATURDAY, APRIL 18TH 
12:00 PM – 7:00 PM 
  
SUNDAY, APRIL 19TH 
12:00 PM – 7:00 PM 
  
MONDAY, APRIL 20TH 
12:00 PM -- 9:00 PM  
  
Event FAQ  

Are Cannabis Cup passes refundable?  No - But passes are transferable and may be resold to someone else if you are unable to attend. 
How can my Colorado-based medical cannabis dispensary compete in the Medical Cannabis Cup?  Entry into the HIGH TIMES Medical Cannabis Cup is limited to legally operating, licensed medical cannabis dispensaries in the state of Colorado. For more information on entering an indica, a sativa, cannabis concentrates or medical-cannabis infused edibles, please contact us directly at (212) 387-0500 or by email cannabiscup@hightimes.com 
Do I get any cannabis as part of my ticket price?  Due to Colorado law we cannot give away cannabis, which is why we’ve kept the ticket price as low as possible while still putting on a world-class event. 
Who can smoke in Denver?  Everyone 21+ in designated recreating areas.  Colorado residents 18+ with medical recommendations.    Are out-of-staters allowed to partake?  Yes, 21+
description.html:
In 2015, HIGH TIMES will return to the Mile High City for our fifth event at the Denver Mart. Our first two events in Denver were Medical Cannabis Cups, restricted to medical patients only. But Colorado voters legalized adult, recreational use of marijuana in the 2012 election, which resulted in our most successful Cannabis Cup ever. We now host the US Cannabis Cup, an event open to all adults.

  • This event (expo and Saturday night party) is for all adults ages 18+ EXCEPT FOR SUPER VIP & GOLD LEAF VIP which is 21+ only. 21+ to enter Recreating (smoking) Area.
  • You do not need a medical card to attend the expo.
  • Tickets are non-refundable, but they are transferable and may be resold to someone else if you are unable to attend

Event Details

SATURDAY, APRIL 18TH

12:00 PM – 7:00 PM


SUNDAY, APRIL 19TH

12:00 PM – 7:00 PM


MONDAY, APRIL 20TH

12:00 PM -- 9:00 PM


Event FAQ

Are Cannabis Cup passes refundable?
No - But passes are transferable and may be resold to someone else if you are unable to attend.

How can my Colorado-based medical cannabis dispensary compete in the Medical Cannabis Cup?
Entry into the HIGH TIMES Medical Cannabis Cup is limited to legally operating, licensed medical cannabis dispensaries in the state of Colorado. For more information on entering an indica, a sativa, cannabis concentrates or medical-cannabis infused edibles, please contact us directly at (212) 387-0500 or by email cannabiscup@hightimes.com

Do I get any cannabis as part of my ticket price?
Due to Colorado law we cannot give away cannabis, which is why we’ve kept the ticket price as low as possible while still putting on a world-class event.

Who can smoke in Denver?
Everyone 21+ in designated recreating areas. Colorado residents 18+ with medical recommendations.

Are out-of-staters allowed to partake?
Yes, 21+

description.text: HIGH TIMES is the world's leading cannabis culture publication. For more than 40 years, HIGH TIMES has been the authoritative source for marijuana cultivation information, bud shots, celebrity interviews, reportings on the counterculture, and more.
description.html: HIGH TIMES is the world's leading cannabis culture publication. For more than 40 years, HIGH TIMES has been the authoritative source for marijuana cultivation information, bud shots, celebrity interviews, reportings on the counterculture, and more.

ticket_classes.name: One Day Pass: Saturday

ticket_classes.name: 3-Day HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Ticket + Saturday Night Concert
ticket_classes.description:
3-Day HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Ticket + Saturday Night Concert Includes:
  • 3-Day Admission to the HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Saturday 4/18 - Monday 4/20
  • One (1) General Admission Ticket to the Official HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Red Rocks Concert on Saturday 4/18 featuring SOJA, J-Boog & NAS
  • Invitation to the HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Awards Show - Sunday 4/19

ticket_classes.description:
3-Day HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Ticket + Monday Night Concert Includes:

  • One (1) Lawn Ticket to the Official HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Fiddler's Green Concert - Monday 4/20 featuring Snoop Dogg
  • Invitation to the HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Awards Show - Sunday 4/19

ticket_classes.name: VIP
ticket_classes.description:
THE VIP TICKET INCLUDES:
  • 3-Day Admission to the HIGH TIMES US Denver Cannabis Cup- Saturday 4/18 - Monday 4/20
  • One (1) General Admission Seated Ticket the Official HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Red Rocks Concert on Saturday 4/18 featuring SOJA, J-Boog & NAS at Red Rocks
  • Invitation to the HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Awards Show - Sunday 4/19
  • One (1) General Admission Seated Ticket to the Official HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Fiddler's Green Concert on Monday 4/20 featuring Snoop Dogg
  • Express VIP Entry
  • Exclusive Q&A Session with Guest Lecturers
  • Exclusive Comedy Performances & Movie Screenings
  • High Society Lounge Access
  •      HIGH TIMES Cover to Cover Display
  •      Munchie Station
  •      Comfortable Seating
  • Access to "The Green Room" - a VIP Only Recreating (Smoking) Lounge with the finest apparatus’
  •      BYOC – Bring Your Own Cannabis
  •      Comfortable Seating
  • Limited Edition HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Poster
  • HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup 2015 T-Shirt
  • Event Guide Book
  • Roundtrip Shuttle Transportation from Denver Mart to the Show Venues Each Night
  • *Must be 18+ to purchase, must have Colorado Medical Card or be 21+ to enter recreating areas

ticket_classes.name: Super VIP
ticket_classes.description:
THE SUPER VIP TICKET INCLUDES:
  • All VIP Amenities Plus:
  • Invitation to Meet the Editors including HIGH TIMES Cultivation Editor Danny Danko
  • Limited Edition HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Poster Signed By Danny Danko and Nico Escondido
  • Upgraded GA Ticket to a Premium Reserved Seat for the official US HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup concerts on 4/18 & 4/20
  • Premium Reserved Area at the HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Awards Show

  • Exclusive Super VIP Lounge
  •      Catered Lunch Daily
  •      Massages
  • Free Subscription to HIGH TIMES
  • Free Subscription to Cover to Cover archives
  • *Must be 21+ to purchase this package

ticket_classes.name: Gold Leaf VIP
ticket_classes.description:
THE GOLD LEAF VIP INCLUDES:
  • All VIP & Super VIP Package Elements Plus:
  • Exclusive Limited Edition High Times Golden Glassware
  • Opportunity to Present a Trophy to a HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Awards Show Winner
  • Backstage Access during the HIGH TIMES US Cannabis Cup Awards Show

name.text: MI Brewers Guild 10th Annual Winter Beer Festival - Feb. 27 & 28, 2015
name.html: MI Brewers Guild 10th Annual Winter Beer Festival - Feb. 27 & 28, 2015

description.text:
Join us February 27 & 28 at Fifth Third Ballpark in Comstock Park, just north of Grand Rapids, to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the most popular Michigan Brewers Guild festival. The newly-expanded event will feature over 90 Michigan breweries and more than 800 craft beers, as well as local music, ice sculptures and carving demonstrations, fire pits to chase away the cold, and food available for purchase. 
FAQs 
Is this an outdoor event? 
Yes! This festival takes place outdoors. In February. In Michigan. Please make wardrobe choices accordingly. 
  
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? 
All festival attendees must be 21 or older to enter, even if they are designated drivers and are not drinking. A valid government ID is required for festival entry, with NO exceptions. 
  
Where do I pick up my tokens? 
You can pick up tokens from the token tent immediately after entering the festival. 
  
Why do I need to use tokens if I already paid for a ticket? 
The Michigan Brewers Guild utilizes drink tokens and specially marked cups to assure that we comply with Michigan Liquor Control Commission regulation and have a controlled means of serving beer. All festivals attendees are expected to willingly provide a token for each and every sample of beer received. Thank you for your cooperation which keeps us in compliance with state law. 
  
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? 
Parking will be available at Fifth Third Ballpark. There will also be a shuttle (reservations required) running from several area hotels as well as downtown. More shuttle information will be posted to our website at www.mibeer.com/winter-festival as it becomes available - or visit Experience Grand Rapids for more details. 
  
What can/can't I bring to the event? 
The following items are not permitted on festival grounds: outside alcohol, glass containers, children, animals, bicycles, skateboards, or rollerskates/rollerblades. 
You may bring any of the following items with you to the festival: water and other non-alcoholic beverages in non-glass containers, food, coolers, hydration backpacks, folding/camping chairs. 
  
Is my registration/ticket transferrable? How do I transfer my ticket to another attendee? 
Yes, tickets are transferrable - but each bar code will only scan one time. You do not need to do anything special to transfer your ticket to another attendee's name. Purchaser name will not be checked against ID-holder name at the gate. 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
You must bring a ticket with you to be scanned to allow you entry to the festival. This ticket can either be printed or be the electronic version accessible on your smartphone or wireless device. 
  
How can I get early admission to the event? 
Enthusiasts with valid membership ID card and VIPs with valid VIP pass will be permitted into the festival early (2pm Friday / noon Saturday), one hour prior to general admission. If you'd like to participate in early entry, you can sign up as an Enthusiast Member prior to the festival date. 
  
What is the refund policy? 
Tickets are non-refundable. The festival will occur rain (or snow) or shine. 
  
Can I buy a Designated Driver ticket and then buy tokens for drinks if I change my mind? 
No. Servers will not pour beer to Designated Drivers, and anyone caught drinking on a Designated Driver ticket will be immediately ejected from the festival. 
  
Where can I find more information about the festival? 
For the most current information, visit our website at www.mibeer.com/winter-festival.

For the most current information, visit our website at www.mibeer.com/winter-festival.

ticket_classes.name: FRIDAY session - Feb. 27, 3pm-7pm
ticket_classes.description: Includes 15 taster tokens (to be picked up at event); must be 21 or older with ID for entry. Tickets are non-refundable; event will occur regardless of weather conditions. Festival will be held outside, so plan appropriately. Early admission for VIP/Enthusiast begins at 2pm Friday. Must have valid Enthusiast membership card or VIP pass to enter early.

ticket_classes.name: SATURDAY session - Feb. 28, 1pm-6pm
ticket_classes.description: Includes 15 taster tokens (to be picked up at event); must be 21 or older with ID for entry. Tickets are non-refundable; event will occur regardless of weather conditions. Festival will be held outside, so plan appropriately. Early admission for VIP/Enthusiast begins at noon on Saturday. Must have valid Enthusiast membership card or VIP pass to enter early.

ticket_classes.name: DESIGNATED DRIVER; Friday session - Feb. 27, 3pm-7pm
ticket_classes.description: Non-drinking ticket only. All guests must be 21 or older with ID for entry. Tickets are non-refundable; event will occur regardless of weather conditions. Festival will be held outside, so plan appropriately. Early admission for VIP/Enthusiast begins at 2pm Friday. Must have valid Enthusiast membership card or VIP pass to enter early.

description.text:
The IFC Fairgrounds returns to SXSW for 3 days in 2015: 
Thursday, March 19th from 4 - 10 PM 
Friday, March 20th from 4 - 10 PM 
Saturday, March 21st from 4 - 10 PM  
  
Part state fair, part carnival, this outdoor music event features some of the most buzzed-about bands at SXSW performing alongside rides, food, carnival games and kick-ass giveaways. Sound awesome? Yeah, we know.  
  
Featuring performances by: 
Twin Peaks 
Rubblebucket 
Jukebox the Ghost 
Colony House 
Odesza 
Priory 
X Ambassadors 
Robert DeLong 
HOLYCHILD 
Sun Club 
COIN 
... and more to be announced shortly!  
  
Other Highlights Include: 
Grub from your favorite Austin-based food trucks 
Giant Three-story Fun Slide  
Mechanical Bull  
Airstream Photo Trailer 
Human Sticky Wall 
Game Shack 
Pool Lounge  
  
The IFC Fairgrounds is  open to everyone. So set your calendar reminders, grab your friends and RSVP now!  
  
Keep Checking IFC.com/SXSW for updates and the full artist lineup!

name.text: FIRST STEPS Homes Show Spring 2015 hosted by Share to Buy
name.html: FIRST STEPS Homes Show Spring 2015 hosted by Share to Buy

description.text:
FIRST STEPS Homes Show Spring 2015 
  
Join us a the FIRST STEPS Homes Show Spring 2015 hosted by Share to Buy, on Saturday 14th March 2015. The Homes Show is the major event for first time buyers in London. Attending the event is the best way to get all the latest information on the affordable home ownership market in the capital. 
  
The FIRST STEPS Homes Show is FREE to attend and takes place at the Queen Elizabeth II Conference Centre, Westminster, from 10am - 5pm. This is a drop-in event, you are not required to be there all day. This is a ticket only event. 
  
FIRST STEPS is The Mayor of London's affordable home ownership scheme and aims to help Londoners onto the property ladder. 
  
At the show will be: 

The major providers of affordable home ownership in London, with details of a range of available properties across the capital
Major developers of Shared Ownership including L&Q, Moat Homes and East Thames
Expert advice from Help to Buy London and Countryside
One-on-one sessions with mortgage experts, including TMP Sherwins
Specialist solicitors on hand to take your enquiries about the buying process

  
Event details: 
  

FIRST STEPS Homes Show Spring 2015
14th March 2015, 10am – 5pm.
Queen Elizabeth II Conference Centre, Broad Sanctuary, Westminster, SW1P 3EE

Tweet us @sharetobuy or use #FIRSTSTEPS2015 
Hosted by 
 
www.sharetobuy.com/firststeps 
Like us on Facebook for regular updates on the FIRST STEPS Homes Show Spring 2015 
  
Our Sponsors
